alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 10:25PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Appomattox and Buckingham Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1025 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buckingham, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buckingham... Dillwyn... Pamplin City... New Canton... Toga... Centenary... and Sheppards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
